head.title: Dragons Happy To Be on the Road

hedline.hl1: Dragons Happy To Be on the Road

abstract.p: New York Dragons prepare to face Orlando Predators (S)

block.p: For the Arena League's New York Dragons, there is no place like the road.

The Dragons edged Chicago, 48-45, last week in a home game at Nassau Coliseum in the first round of the playoffs, but they have also won their last six games away from home. Coach Todd Shell, who took over for John Gregory after the team began the season 0-4, has yet to lose a road game.

The Dragons edged Chicago, 48-45, last week in a home game at Nassau Coliseum in the first round of the playoffs, but they have also won their last six games away from home. Coach Todd Shell, who took over for John Gregory after the team began the season 0-4, has yet to lose a road game.
The Dragons, who were 2-6 at home during the regular season, will be on the road again tomorrow when they face the Orlando Predators.

''As far as the road, I think that it's just getting away from everything and being together as a team,'' receiver Chris Anthony said. ''There's just a focus that you get when you do that. I think that is one of the reasons we've played so well on the road.''
